attack type: exclude prosecuted using court records, perform simple attack on released or not charged
disclosure when: after exclusion, failure to protect against simple attacks
remedy: assume all prosecuted can be matched; anonymize released and not charged as a group

attack type: exclude convicted using public records or background check service
disclosure when: after exclusion, failure to protect against simple attacks
risk: arrested and released, not charged, or not convicted
remedy: anonymize released, not charged or not convicted as a group

attack type: exclude convicted using public records etc, examine prosecuted subset
disclosure when: after reviewing court records of those who were prosecuted but not convicted, attacker has not already identified all pertinent data about an individual or crime
risk: any remaining information not already disclosed in court records
remedy: none, disclosure already took place via court records
